course_title: Planning, Implementing & Evaluating Public Health Programs

learning_outcomes.description: Critically appraise relevant evidence to set priorities for health program planning for promotion, prevention and protection.
Conduct a stakeholder analysis to inform the planning and implementation of health programs.
Understand and apply the key principles and frameworks of planning, implementation and evaluation for public health programs.
Create a detailed plan and program logic model for a public health action (including meaningful aims and objectives), with an understanding of its feasibility and sustainability (risks and enablers)
Construct evaluation plans including formative, process, impact and outcome evaluations.
Demonstrate skills in written and oral communication to a range of relevant stakeholders and skills in group work including collaboration, teamwork, self-reflection and group negotiation.

assessments.task_description:
In this task you will develop an implementation plan for a health program design to address a health condition for a particular priority population in Australia. This will be based on one of five assessment scenarios.

You will describe your proposed program in a briefing paper that will be critical in guiding your Executive Team in deciding which programs to further investigate for implementation and evaluation.

Your briefing paper will set out the aims and objectives of your program, identify the key stakeholders and how they will be engaged in in your chosen context. You will create a program logic model which describes your program, and make recommendations for how to proceed with your proposed health program.

This report will be 3 A4 pages maximum (plus an additional page for references). Further instructions will be available via the Course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In this task you will develop a proposal to evaluate a health program designed to address a health condition for a particular priority population in Australia. This will be based on the health program you developed in Assessment Task 1. If you are working in a group, choose one of the health programs developed by your team members for your evaluation proposal.

Your proposal will be used by the Executive Team of the organisation that has implemented the health program to determine which research consultancy organisation they will commission to evaluate the program.

In your proposal, you will articulate evaluation questions that will enable you to measure whether the health program is meeting its aims and objectives. You will outline the design of an evaluation that will allow you to collect the data to answer these evaluation questions. You will also include a timeline, assessment of risks to the evaluation, and a budget, enabling the Executive Team to determine which organisation’s proposal is the most feasible and provides the best value for money.

Your proposal will be 1,500 words long (excluding references). It can be submitted individually OR as part of a group (2-4 people). Further instructions will be available via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
26/05/2026 2:00 pm

For external students, presentations will be organised in advance to take place in the week commencing the 25 of May.
assessments.task_description:
In this task you will present a condensed version of your proposal to evaluate a health program design to address a health condition for a particular priority population in Australia. This will be based on the health program you developed in Assessment Task 1 and the evaluation proposal you developed in Assessment Task 2.

You must work in a group of 3-4 people for this presentation. If you worked in a group for Task 2 you must stay in that group (but you may include new group members if you did not have 4 people in your team for Task 2). If your team members submitted Task 1 and Task 2 individually, choose one of the proposals you developed as the basis for your presentation.

You will be presenting your proposal to the Executive Team of the organisation that has implemented the health program. This presentation is an opportunity to highlight the strengths of your proposal, add new information about how findings will be disseminated, and respond to written feedback (from Task 2) and answer questions orally.  Based on this presentation, the Executive Team will decide which research consultancy will be commissioned to evaluate their health program.

Internal students will do their presentation in person during the usual workshop. Presentation slots will be organised for external students in the same week. Further instructions will be available via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
